result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian K Wood was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brian K Wood was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation apply to both counts.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.   Must attend the Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel session scheduled for 6/08/17 at the Justice Center.

miscConds.notes: $2,100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.   Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.   Must attend the Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel session scheduled for 6/08/17 at the Justice Center.

timeConds.notes:
10 days STAYED upon attendance at VIP. Additional 100 days STAYED. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from DOC. Huber release granted. granted. To commence forthwith.
5/15/17 - Good time granted.

defendant.name: Wood, Brian K

records.addlTxt: of conviction.  Court extends defendants supervision for a period of 12 months from 11/04/18 to 11/04/19 in order to complete AODA treatment. Supervision can discharge during this time once treatment has been completed. DTE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DC Jail petition for sentence modification - Court revokes 30 days of huber/work release privileges.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian K Wood in court with attorney Nathan John Dineen.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 4.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 4. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 3 and 16-TR-2189 & 2191 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant apologizes to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Court denies at this time. DTE
from Atty Dineen requesting plea/sentencing date be set after 4/27/17. State has no objection.
Plea hearing on May 4, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brian K Wood in court with attorney Nathan John Dineen.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Dineen indicates he is still waiting for an open records request from the State of Colorado. Atty Dineen feels matter will resolve short of trial, requests a plea date 45 days out. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 08:15 am.
from Atty Dineen requesting several cases he's representing all be set on same day for travel purposes. Court reschedules.
Status conference on February 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff.
to extend time to file pretrial motions

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Brian K Wood in court with attorney Nathan John Dineen.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint and Amended Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Court grants Defendant's motion to extend time to file pretrial motions. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
